issue.subject: Pictogram public/not public for the ressource
issue.description:
In the frontend, the metadate manager displayed in EasySDI V.1 an icon to show if the metadate is public or private (example : http://www.webpagescreenshot.info/img/38040-628201131332PM).

We do not find this icon in EasySDI V2. 

Is there any reason to this ?

journals.notes: Well, in other words, can we put those picto back ?

Sorry Xavier,

But I don't remember anymore the V1 screen where this picto was available.
Can you just give me more details about it?

PS: We have to keep in mind that migrating EasySDI under new Joomla 2.5 right access engine could change such public/private property...

This old issue is still relevent with the last easySDI version.

I changed this issue from "defect" to "feature" as there is nothing broken but it's a need for users to have this visual information.

I renamed the title.

details.name: subject
details.old_value: Pictogram "metadate public" or "metadate private" not displayed
details.new_value: Pictogram public/not public for the ressource

journals.notes:
Hi Xavier,

Is this feature still relevant with easySDI V4 as interface has been totally rewritten ?

Thanks,

I would say yes but need to be discussed.

I keep it assigned to me until I have a complete answer :-)
I confirm it is still relevant and we suggest to add this info through CSS as described here : #653 (add a CSS class "type of access scope" to each item)

This "feature" has been added with #653.

I suggest to reject it as #653 is closed and  covers a larger perimeter with others enhancement.
